stream_context.summary: Kaze lays out and prototype-builds Course 14 – a craft-material diorama world – deciding routes, platform pieces, and performance constraints while live-testing on real N64 hardware.

development_findings.summary: Course 14’s visual theme is ‘child-craft diorama’: cardboard terrain, toilet-paper-roll mushrooms, stapler needles, crayons, fences and a paper-airplane warp will form the core set pieces.
development_findings.quote: The tree is made out of cardboard; this is a toilet-paper roll with gift wrap on top and a staple needle in it.

development_findings.summary: Kaze sketched multiple non-linear paths with an armature in Blender, ensuring each route gives the fastest access to a different star/object (e.g., red coins, Yoshi doodle, bit pipe).
development_findings.quote: This is very similar to the layout in Peach’s Fury and that one was really not linear.

development_findings.summary: He worries early gameplay feels too linear and keeps repositioning the spawn and major props to add three initial routes and several alternate climbs.

Platforming elements under consideration: tilting cardboard bridges (toothpicks as pivots), pin-head hopping section for a Yoshi coin, half-roll toilet-paper slide, paper-plane ferry between islands, wall-kick mountain climb, crayon/ruler ladders.
Light pass currently auto-generated from a point light; he plans to refine baked lighting so props pop without hiding backgrounds.
Real-hardware profiling shows 18 ms RSP vs 36 ms RDP; overdraw (background still in Z-buffer) is the main bottleneck. Polygon count ~3-4 k, about half the budget.
development_findings.quote: We use more than half, more than our entire RDP budget, but the RDP budget is easy to fix once we cut everything out.

development_findings.summary: Saved ~30 RSP instructions today by caching gMat stack index and inlining Wiseguy’s shadow cross-product; exploring converting gMatStackIndex to gMatStackAdd for another ~20 instr.
development_findings.quote: I found a 30-instruction improvement in graph render again… maybe replacing GMAT stack index with GMAT stack add could save 20 more.

development_findings.summary: Debug level-select occasionally crashes on boot; cause still unknown and complicates testing.
SummerCart is preferred over EverDrive X7 for instant USB ROM uploads (~3 s vs 40 s) and lower cost.
development_findings.quote: EverDrive X7 is dog shit… the Summer Cart just works.

development_findings.summary: A public demo (Course 1 only) will release ‘soon’; no broader playtest yet planned.
development_findings.quote: I’m gonna release a demo soon… it will be somewhat public but it will just be Course 1.

context_findings.summary: Kaze is self-employed and lives off commissions/donations; cannot invoice SimpleFlips for ~$3.5k because he lacks the streamer’s address.
context_findings.quote: He sent me like around $3,500 at this point, but I can't write an invoice to him because he didn't give me his address.

context_findings.summary: He expects to stream less once regular contract work resumes.
context_findings.quote: I'm soon back to work, so I'm gonna be able to stream a lot less.

context_findings.summary: Considers making ‘normie’ SM64 glitch explainer videos (e.g., BLJ) for easy YouTube revenue and channel growth.
context_findings.quote: What do you guys think of me making a video for more basic stuff like ‘How does the BLJ work?’—easy content to produce.

context_findings.summary: Shows pride/excitement over donations and optimization wins; mild frustration with asset sourcing and hardware quirks.
Mentions personal life: enjoys his new automatic lawn mower—a humorous ‘boomer’ moment.
context_findings.quote: I installed an automatic lawnmower and I enjoy my lawnmower right now. That's fucked up, isn't it?

zeina.summary: Zeina joins chat and is designated ‘chat mom’, but no direct development work discussed.
zeina.quote: Zeina's gonna be the chat mom now.

key_stories.title: Designing the Toilet-Paper Mushroom
key_stories.summary: Kaze needed a low-poly yet believable ‘mushroom’ platform. Chat suggested craft references; he settled on a toilet-paper roll stem, gift-wrap cap, and a shiny stapler-needle model for authenticity.
key_stories.challenge: Create a distinctive platform that respects the craft-material theme without blowing the triangle budget.
key_stories.process: Brainstormed textures, rejected complex paper flowers, sourced or hand-built a tiling toilet-paper texture, built a simple shader for glossy wrap, modeled a low-poly staple.
key_stories.outcome: Visual style approved; prop also doubles as a slide variant and anchors several jump sequences.
key_stories.key_quote: This mushroom here works… The tree is made out of cardboard; this is a toilet-paper roll with gift wrap on top and the staple needle in it.

key_stories.title: Real-Hardware Performance Scare
key_stories.summary: After adding props, the level crashed on N64. Kaze re-uploaded via SummerCart, profiled with Nemulator, and discovered anti-aliasing had toggled on, inflating RSP times. Performance now sits at ~50 FPS but overdraw must be fixed.
key_stories.challenge: Level wouldn’t boot and frame-time spiked on console.
key_stories.process: Unplugged/replugged hardware, re-flashed ROM, compared Project64 vs Nemulator visuals, measured RSP/RDP, toggled AA, identified overdraw of background.
key_stories.outcome: Stability restored; clear to optimize by cutting hidden polygons and rewriting GMAT stack calls.
key_stories.key_quote: 18 ms RSP, 36 ms RDP—it's all the overdraw. Once we cut everything out, it's going to be a lot better.

key_stories.title: Texture Hunt for a Simple Toilet-Roll
key_stories.summary: Searching for a free toilet-paper texture consumed minutes and derailed progress. Stock sites charged $2–15; chat finally DM’d a usable photo that Kaze tiled manually.
key_stories.challenge: Avoid paying or waiting for a mundane asset.
key_stories.process: Scoured TextureResource, ArtStation, Shutterstock; debated AI; cropped & tiled chat-supplied image.
key_stories.outcome: Functional texture created, illustrating the micro-budget, DIY ethos of the project.
key_stories.key_quote: Why is everyone trying to sell empty toilet paper rolls? Can't just give it to me for free?
